abstract: Health insurance providers are bracing for possibility that Supreme Court may rule in case King v Burwell that federal subsidies for customers in states that did not set up their own insurance marketplaces are illegal, which could affect around 6.4 million people.
lead_paragraph: About 6.4 million people could lose subsidies if the court decides the Affordable Care Act does not allow them in states without their own insurance marketplaces.

headline.main: Health Insurers Brace for Supreme Court Ruling
headline.print_headline: Insurers Gird for Court’s Health Ruling

snippet: About 6.4 million people could lose subsidies if the court decides the Affordable Care Act does not allow them in states without their own insurance marketplaces.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
